overview: Arbitrage bounds, stock price dynamics, geometric Brownian motion and Itos Lemma, Cox-Ross-Rubinstein binomial model, Black-Scholes model, risk neutral valuation, forwards and futures, currency, stock index, futures and exotic options, Interest rate derivative securities.
intended learning outcomes: Explain the role of arbitrage as a basis for determining the prices of financial securities;
Compare the various dynamics of stock price and interest rate models;
Explain the derivation of key option pricing models including the Cox-Ross-Rubinstein Binomial model and the Black-Scholes model;
Analyse the use of arbitrage pricing techniques to value other classes of derivative securities including forwards, futures, swaps and interest rate derivatives;
Analyse the theoretical limitations of key pricing models and on practical difficulties which arise in their implementation.

additional pre-requisite: Admission into the BH-COM Bachelor of Commerce (Degree with Honours)

Semester 2.Contact hours: Three hours of lectures and seminars per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
